intro: Galactia lignosa, commonly known as the red mallow or red mallow tree, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features compound leaves with oval or lance-shaped leaflets and produces showy, pink to red flowers clustered in racemes. Its bark is typically rough and fissured, and it can grow as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Galactia lignosa is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in dry climates.
